Company Name Crossover for Work Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

We're running an Online Hiring Event this Saturday, to hire Java Software Engineering Managers ($100K/yr).

Online Hiring Events are live forums designed to enable you to understand the role and requirements through an interactive Q&A session followed by a self-directed testing process. The testing takes between 3-5 hours to complete. It’s worth taking the time to finish all the tests because we evaluate every single complete application to find the top talent.

This event will include all testing required to apply for the role. Upon grading the tests, and if you advance, we will set up an interview with the hiring manager.

The Java Software Engineering Manager will serve as a key member of our global executive team and will be responsible for delivering high-quality products.

This leadership position demands proficiency to conduct tech reviews, improve productivity from your engineering organization and guide a talented global pool of professionals to solve business problems continuously.

We are looking for hands-on leaders with a robust Cloud background, who are comfortable with aggressive weekly targets and have the ability to leverage their technical depth to set the standard for software engineering excellence.

Candidate Requirements
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (MS or Ph.D. preferred) is absolutely mandatory
  • 10+ years of experience in hands-on software development/engineering
  • 3+ years experience in leading software development teams
  • Experience in managing teams of 10+ people
  • 3+ years of experience releasing software products within a CI/CD environment
  • Hands-on experience in Java architecture and programming
  • Proven experience in building high-performance teams and scalable best engineering practices
  • Excellent understanding of current enterprise software technologies and development practices/tools, including virtualization, source control, build and test automation, code quality automation technologies
  • Experience with high-end enterprise systems deployed in environments of Global 100 corporation complexity
  • Proficiency in Test Automation, AWS and TDD is desired but not mandatory
  • Demonstrated success as a problem solver, result-oriented, self-starter
  • Comfortable “working virtually” with teammates and customers around the world. We do a lot of Skype and video conferencing
  • Good proficiency in the English language
System Pre-requisites

These are the recommended and minimum system requirements for participating in the online hiring event.

  • Any IDE

    • Join our community of remote professionals!

    We have over 4,000 Crossover team members and are growing our network around the world.

    Crossover is redefining the way people work. A future where all high-skill jobs go to the cloud and big-data is used to help individuals and teams become more and more productive. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our workforce is global and will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent and are now in over 108 different countries. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing cloud talent. Our platform connects customers to the world’s best people for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Manager, Saltwater Community Mental Health Team

Company Name Mercy Health Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Role
  • Full time, maternity leave backfill (12 Nov 2018-29 Nov 2019), ADO included
  • Registered Psychiatric Nurse Grade 5, occupational therapist or Social Worker Chief Grade 3, psychologist Grade 4
  • Based at Saltwater Clinic, Footscray. Travel to other sites within the Mercy Mental Health Program is required.
  • To supervise work and contribute to development of a high quality, effective, and efficient Mental Health Team.
  • To monitor and evaluate the services provided against Mercy Health’s aim to deliver high quality, responsive, accessible, clinical services in line with legislation and in the spirit of the Mercy Mission and values.
  • To report to and support the Mental Health Leadership (Program Director, Clinical Director, Recovery Services Manager in the leadership of the overall mental health program through participation in governance, projects and other activities
About You
  • You will have an AASW accredited Bachelor Degree or entry level Master’s Degree of Social Work that provides eligibility for membership of the Australian Association of Social Workers
  • An approved degree in Psychology and registration with AHPRA as a Psychologist with endorsement as a Clinical Psychologist or
  • Registration with AHPRA as a Registered Nurse with successful completion of a specialist undergraduate psychiatric nursing program or a Post graduate Psychiatric/mental health nursing qualification, or
  • Registration with AHPRA as an Occupational Therapist
  • Holds a current Victorian Driver’s license
  • Post graduate qualification and / or experience in leadership and management.
About Us

Mercy Mental Health supports people in south west metropolitan Melbourne with severe and complex mental illnesses by providing acute and community-based care. Services are available to adults through acute inpatient programs, residential rehabilitation programs and crisis and community recovery-focused treatment programs. We also offer inpatient and community specialist perinatal mental health services to women and infants in western Victoria.

Mercy Health is a Catholic organisation employing over 8500 people who provide compassionate and holistic care through our acute hospitals, aged care facilities, mental health programs, palliative and respite services, maternity and women’s health services, early parenting services and home care services.

Mercy Health is proud to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the WGEA.

What We Offer
  • Values driven culture
  • Salary packaging benefits
  • Leadership Capability Framework to support your career progression and development
  • Camp Australia School Holiday Program
  • Thrive @ Mercy – our health & wellbeing hub supporting you to be the best you can be
  • Stepping Stones – our flexibility framework supporting your growth and work life balance
  • Fully funded childcare referral service
To find out more about these exciting initiatives, please visit Mercy Health Careers homepage (http//careers.mercy.com.au/)

At Mercy Health we pride ourselves on embracing diversity and foster an inclusive culture where individual differences are respected and celebrated. We encourage applications from people of all ages, abilities and cultural backgrounds including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Digital Marketing Lead

Company Name HASSELL Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Creative Studio | Global focus | Digital transformation project

The role

We are looking for a Digital Marketing Leader to join us for a 12-month contract (parental leave replacement). This is a senior role where you’ll be responsible for leading and implementing key brand and digital marketing transformation projects that support our business strategy, improve our digital brand experience and support our global expansion.

You’ll be working with our agency partners to build better digital brand experiences across all our owned, earned and paid marketing channels and platforms including web, email and social media.

You’ll be primarily responsible for leading the development of the new HASSELL and FreeState website and blog projects and new email marketing strategy.

You will report to the Head of Marketing and Communications and will collaborate with our senior brand leadership group including CEO, MD and Heads of Design along with the wider network of Principals, leaders and the business. You’ll also be responsible for leading the in-house team and agencies working closely with you on these projects.

About You

You are a strategic marketing practitioner with 8+ years’ experience in both B2B and B2C environments. Ideally, you will have spent six years working in digitally focused roles across all elements of paid, owned and earned digital media, preferably for creative, global brands.

You love all things digital, and will have worked on developing and implementing multiple organisation wide digital marketing strategies that include website re-development and blog projects (preferably for complex organisations with sub-brands and/or microsites). You will need to be just as comfortable developing content marketing strategies as you are implementing them across web, email, social and marketing automation platforms.

A natural self-starter and communicator, you’ll also have experience managing agency relationships, leading high performing teams and be comfortable working in-house in a fast-paced internal agency environment.

Why HASSELL?

We consider our people to be our greatest resource. With that in mind, we place great emphasis on attracting, retaining and developing the best talent. We place value on the quality of ideas and the contribution our people make to our open and collaborative culture. We support innovation and creativity to enable exceptional design outcomes.

Benefits

Our team has access to a range of benefits to support development and wellbeing

We value diversity, employing people across a number of regions, representing many different cultures and ethnic backgrounds.

_Creative studio working environment
_Inter studio transfer opportunities
_Development and training
_Wellbeing benefits
_Flexible start and finish times, part time and job share arrangements
_Professional memberships
_Study assistance.

If you aspire to create great digital experiences, and are looking to take the next step in your career with an international design practice, this is the role for you.

Apply now

Please send your application to careers@hassellstudio.com and ensure that you have the following subject line on your application – Digital Marketing Leader_Melbourne_AUG2018.

HASSELL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

No agencies or third party applications please.

Full-time

Content Producer/Administrator

Company Name PwC Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 77 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle
  • #1 LinkedIn Top Company to work for in 2018
  • 12 month contract
Exciting entry level opportunity to join PwC’s Digital Pulse team as a Content Producer and Administrator, to help drive the global expansion of a leading digital publication.

The Opportunity

PwC’s Digital Pulse is a digital publication that seeks to lead the conversation around the digital disruption and innovation that is transforming the world around us. Originally launched out of the Australian consulting business within PwC’s Experience Centre, Digital Pulse has a mandate to do things differently with regards to traditional thought leadership. We take an editorial approach to developing content that profiles leading industry experts within the firm, with a goal to establishing a clear point of view that helps clients and the broader society navigate the fast evolving digital economy.

With Digital Pulse now expanding into a global publication as the voice of PwC Digital Services in the market, we are looking for a Content Producer and administrator to join our team.

Reporting to the Global Content Editor and Managing Editor, the dual function of this development role is to write and publish content to the web, while assuming responsibility for completing the administrative tasks that underpin the smooth running of the publication.

You will
  • Research, interview and write commissioned articles for Digital Pulse under the guidance of the content editor, with a view toward continued writing development
  • Write short pieces to introduce infographics/video content/newsletters
  • Look after back-end publishing of all articles, including optimising SEO, metadata and producing images in Photoshop
  • Engage with local and international experts to develop story ideas to pitch to content editor
  • Produce and send a weekly newsletter including managing its subscriber list
  • Distribute articles to relevant stakeholders to drive growth in readership, and identify and curate a stakeholder list
  • Assist the Managing Editor with the day-to-day running of the website, report issues and keep contributor pages up-to-date

About You

The brief is simple….

You ideally have at least 1 - 2 years experience in a similar role or as a journalist, copywriter or communications professional and hold a relevant degree qualification in that field. You are passionate about developing skills in creating engaging and informative content and have a demonstrable background in online publishing and administration. You have strong attention to detail, exceptional organisational skills and can multitask while working to strict deadlines.

Your colleagues can vouch that you
  • Act with integrity and show care for the people you work with
  • Have a flair for building strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders
  • Show potential to reimagine the possible

What We Offer

Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Evalyne Findanis is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

AOD Youth and Family Counsellor

Company Name Anglicare Victoria Company Location Frankston

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Are you passionate about working with clients and their families to achieve positive outcomes?
  • Are you interested in an exciting opportunity to join a friendly and supportive team of alcohol and other drug clinicians.
  • 3 days a week (0.6EFT) until 30 June 2019

About Us:


At Anglicare Victoria our focus is on transforming the futures of children and young people, families and adults. Our work is based on three guiding pillars, Prevent, Protect, Empower. We offer a comprehensive network of services and seek to ensure the provision of high quality services that will bring about significant improvements in the life experience of the young people, children and families/caregivers with whom we work.


The Role:


The Linking Youth and Families Together (LYFT) Program aims to reduce problematic alcohol and other drug use among young people and the adverse effects on them and their families.\xa0 The program does this by providing information, support and family inclusive therapeutic treatment as well as linkages to other community supports. \xa0The primary client group for LYFT are young people aged between 12 – 25 years who are using alcohol and other drugs in a problematic way and their families.\xa0


To Be Successful in this Position You Will Need:


  • A relevant tertiary qualification in Social Work, Psychology, Early Childhood Specialist and/or related behavioural sciences at degree level with substantial experience; or associate diploma level with substantial experience in the relevant service stream, or less formal qualifications with specialised skills sufficient to perform at this level.\xa0
  • Knowledge and experience of contemporary practice approaches in the alcohol and other drug sector.
  • Knowledge and experience of the application of systemic theory and practice techniques in therapy with families, with specific emphasis on adolescents and their parents.\xa0
  • Experience in working with young people, and knowledge of therapeutic interventions appropriate for young people at risk.
  • The ability to self-manage and practice high level organisations skills, time management skills and self-direction.
  • Applicants must also possess minimum competencies in Alcohol and Other Drugs.

Please Note: It is mandatory for the successful applicant to hold a current Working with Children Check and be prepared to undergo a National Criminal History Check prior to commencement.


To apply for this position you will need to complete the online application. You will be requested to attach your resume and your responses to the Key Selection Criteria as separate documents.


For further enquiries contact Reynold Ephraim (Team Leader AOD) on 97816700


Applications\xa0Close 17 October 2018.


We encourage and welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People.

Mid-Senior level

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Job description

Computershare Plan Managers (CPM) is the division within Computershare responsible for providing administrative services, project management and plan design to Plan Manager Clients and their individual employee share plan holders. CPM is the largest provider of Employee Share Plan management services in Australia, managing the share plans for over 100 clients covering over 300,000 underlying participants.

Reporting to a Client Services Manager, the Client Services Associate is a specialist role responsible for the day to day delivery of high quality service to clients and the respective client’s employee plan participants.

The Client Service Associate will work closely with the Client Service Manager and internal stakeholders to ensure all functions and activity of their client accounts are anticipated, actioned and when required, reviewed in order to meet strict deadlines.

These functions include:

    • Responding to customer enquiries
    • Maintenance of the employee register
    • Reporting
    • Purchases
    • Processing sales
    • Involvement in dividend payments

Working with a supportive manager and an experienced team, this role will be a great way to learn more about the financial services industry, as well as give you the ability to gain exposure to great opportunities for career growth and development.

Key responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

  • Management of Client Account and day to day operations of Client's Employee Share Plans
  • Responding to written, email and telephone share holder enquiries
  • Maintaining employee information held in internal systems and databases
  • Reconciliation of accounts and transactions
  • Maintenance of internal timetables for all clients in terms (as they relate to dividends, ad hoc payments, offers and statements)
  • Preparation of share transfers, sales and purchases
  • Maintaining Service Level Agreements

To ensure your success in this role you will bring:

  • Ability to manage changing priorities and strong time management skills
  • A high level of attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal and verbal & written communication skills
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team
  • High level of initiative, flexibility and problem solving skills
  • Strong PC skills with a high level of familiarity with MS Office products – specifically MS Excel
  • Possess and display a positive, enthusiastic attitude & strong work ethic
  • Possess the ability to work well under pressure, maintaining professionalism and a focus on quality

Knowledge of Employee Share Plans and the financial services will be highly regarded.

The benefits:

  • Work for a large global corporation (over 15,000 employees) with the opportunity for career progression
  • Great discounts and benefits across a variety of companies and access to our Employee Share Plan
  • A wide variety of internal training courses supported by our Learning and Development team
  • A supportive working environment, with friendly peers and management
  • Easy access to public transport, bicycle and walking paths, with an onsite Gym, Caf\xe9 and games room

To apply click on the apply button and follow the application process

Applicants need to hold Australian Citizenship or a Permanent Residency.

Computershare may conduct a criminal background check on applicants subject to current legislation.

We want every person who joins our team, every customer and every supplier to feel welcome. We see diversity as a source of strength - the more perspectives we have, the better equipped we’ll be to meet the demands of our diverse global customer base. We believe in equality for everyone, regardless of age, ethnicity, gender identity, race, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

| CERTAINTY | INGENUITY | ADVANTAGE |

Digital Insights & Data Science Lead

Company Name Origin Energy Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 98 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Provide unique and targeted insights
  • Inform tactical and strategic direction
  • Newly created position – make it your own
  • Location: Melbourne, VIC
  • Application close date: 2 October 2018


Origin - Australia's Leading Integrated Energy Company

An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.

Origin is the largest energy retailer in Australia, and with 4.3 million customers we’re constantly evolving and changing to better suit their needs. Our activities include power generation, energy trading, the sale of LPG, electricity, natural gas and solar as well as the development of new and emerging technologies. Consider your possibilities with Australia’s leading integrated energy company.

The Role

At Origin, our ambition is to create the world's leading digital energy experience by transforming the way customers digitally engage with and consume energy. At the centre of this transformation is Customer Analytics – a team full of passionate people who are thinking outside-of-the-box to leverage innovation in data and analytics to deliver a personalised experience for our customers.

Responsiblities

The Digital Insights Manager is a key member of the team and will be responsible for

The Advanced Analytics team plays a pivotal role in providing valuable, real time insights into customer behaviours and preferences that inform tactical decision making and longer term strategic direction for Retail and Future Energy & Business Development.
  • Create a new data and analytics capability focussed on Origin's Digital business, foster an energetic and vibrant environment, role modelling effective ways of working across the Digital group and with other stakeholders to promote engaged, connected and high performing teams
  • Drive thought leadership and inform decision making through expert statistical and quantitative analysis of prospect and customer interactions and transactional behaviours through Origin's Digital channels
  • Work closely with digital, commercial, and other teams in Customer Analytics to identify and realise opportunities to create personalised digital experiences and improve digital sales and service outcomes through the application of maths and advanced quantitative modelling, data mining, and machine learning techniques
  • Design, develop, test and deploy analytical services/features and algorithms that can be integrated into our digital platforms, products and experiences, requiring close working relationships with Product Management, Experience Design, and Digital Development teams
  • Team across Customer Analytics to contribute to the establishment of unified view of customers; create a consistent view of business performance; and build a shared library of insights and models to drive deeper customer insights and more personalised customer experiences
  • Rally teams together and communicate effectively with stakeholders to align their decisions and actions with analytics insights

As a key member of the Advanced Analytics team you will be responsible for building advanced quantitative models that are integrated into our digital processes and platforms in order to power personalised customer experiences and enhance digital sales and service outcomes.

We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

Make an impact on Australia's energy future

If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.
Our story | Origin Energy

For more information contact Iain Pratt on (03) 8665 7325
